Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Glutamine-Supplemented Parenteral Nutrition in Surgical ICU Patients

Participants.evidence: adults post-gastrointestinal, vascular, or cardiac surgery requiring PN and SICU care

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either standard GLN-free PN (STD-PN) or PN containing alanyl-GLN dipeptide (GLN-PN)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the effect of GLN-supplemented PN on clinical outcomes in SICU patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoints were hospital mortality and infections.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 150 participants were randomized, 75 to each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Hospital mortality was 14.7% in the GLN-PN group and 17.3% in the STD-PN group (difference, −2.6%; 95% CI −14.6 to 9.3%; P = 0.66).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups.
